sentences: Hoidin toolist kinni, et ei kukkuks.
context: The Estonian word 'kinni' is a versatile adverb with multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean 'closed' (when referring to doors, windows etc.), 'holding/grabbing', 'fastened/attached', 'full/filled', or refer to catching things or stopping. It's commonly used in everyday situations from describing closed objects to physical actions of holding or tying something.
